books.title: A Popular Schoolgirl
books.author: Angela Brazil
books.summary: A schoolgirl navigates a difficult year after a new girl has inadvertently assumed her mantle.

books.title: The Black Arrow
books.author: Robert Louis Stevenson
books.summary: During the War of the Roses, a young knight must rescue his lady and find out who killed his father.

books.title: The Autobiography of John Stuart Mill
books.author: John Stuart Mill
books.summary: The autobiography of English philosopher John Stuart Mill.

books.title: Eminent Victorians
books.author: Lytton Strachey
books.summary: Four witty and biting biographies of Victorians that take aim at the moral superiority of their subject’s time.

books.title: Dorothy and the Wizard in Oz
books.author: L. Frank Baum
books.summary: A young girl and her companions travel through dangerous underground realms with the help of an old friend.

books.title: Ukridge Stories
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: A collection of stories featuring P. G. Wodehouse’s charismatic character Stanley Featherstonehaugh Ukridge.

books.title: Timon of Athens
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: A wealthy Athenian lord becomes poor and friendless after his “friends” take advantage of his hospitality.

books.title: At the Back of the North Wind
books.author: George MacDonald
books.summary: A young boy’s life is transformed by his visit to the country at the back of the north wind.

books.title: Shorts from Scenes from Private Life
books.author: Honoré de Balzac
books.summary: Short fiction from the “Scenes from Private Life” section of Balzac’s Human Comedy.

books.title: Brood of the Witch-Queen
books.author: Sax Rohmer
books.summary: A father and son duo investigate a man who is wielding ancient Egyptian magic.

books.title: Scrambles Amongst the Alps in the Years 1860–69
books.author: Edward Whymper
books.summary: A classic in early mountaineering literature, describing the first ascent of the Matterhorn and other climbs in the Alps.

books.title: The Hidden Staircase
books.author: Carolyn Keene
books.summary: A young amateur detective investigates a supposed haunting.

books.title: How the Other Half Lives
books.author: Jacob Riis
books.summary: A social reformer documents the living conditions of the poor in the tenements of New York City.

books.title: Short Works
books.author: Epictetus
books.summary: A collection of Epictetus’s short works.

books.title: Cane
books.author: Jean Toomer
books.summary: An experimental and highly lyrical novel exploring the African-American experience.

books.title: The Works of Max Beerbohm
books.author: Max Beerbohm
books.summary: A collection of satirical essays ridiculing pretentiousness through imitation.

books.title: Planet of the Damned
books.author: Harry Harrison
books.summary: A planetary champion finds himself employed to solve another planet’s pressing problem.

books.title: Golf Stories
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: A collection of Wodehouse’s golf stories featuring the Oldest Member.

books.title: Gitanjali
books.author: Rabindranath Tagore
books.summary: Prose poems of offering translated by the author from the original Bengali.

books.title: The Giant Raft
books.author: Jules Verne
books.summary: A former slave trader with an encrypted note schemes about its meaning, while a man with a secret past travels with his family down the Amazon in a giant raft to attend his daughter’s wedding.
